title: Private Tour: Pachacamac Archaeological Site Including Barranco District
description: Experience two different sides of Lima’s history during this 3-hour private guided tour to the Pre-Columbian site of Pachacamac and then the charming neighborhood of Barranco. Journey by private vehicle 19 miles (31 kilometers) south from Lima to visit Pachacamac, an archaeological site and one-time sacred center used by local residents for well over 1,000 years prior to the arrival of the Spanish. Then proceed to Barranco, a charming 19th century beach resort for Lima’s aristocracy that today is home to many of the city’s artists.
all_descriptions: Experience two different sides of Lima’s history during this 3-hour private guided tour to the Pre-Columbian site of Pachacamac and then the charming neighborhood of Barranco. Journey by private vehicle 19 miles (31 kilometers) south from Lima to visit Pachacamac, an archaeological site and one-time sacred center used by local residents for well over 1,000 years prior to the arrival of the Spanish. Then proceed to Barranco, a charming 19th century beach resort for Lima’s aristocracy that today is home to many of the city’s artists.

ItineraryThis is a typical itinerary for this productPass By:Miraflores District, Lima PeruLearn some local history while we visite Miraflores districtPass By:Humedal Pantanos de Villa, Hernando La Valle S/N Avenue Vista Alegre, Lima 15067, Chorillos, Peru, Lima PeruBirdwatching will be available while we drive to the south to PachacamacStop At:Pachacamac Ruins, Lurin 47 kilometers Southeast of the Lima Historic Center, Lima 15841 PeruWalk around the site and learn from your knowledgeable guide about its history and how it is the major Pre-Hispanic ceremonial center on the Pacific Coast of America. It has places of pilgrimage for worshiping and consulting the oracle of Pachacamac, who was “The Lord of the World”. The temple is totally built in adobe (mud bricks) and you will see all its temples including Adobito’s Temple, Templo with ramp, Taurichumbi Palace, Pachacamac Palace, Temple of the Sun, Philigrims Square and Acllahuasi.Duration: 2 hoursStop At:Bridge of Sighs, Jr. Batallon, Ayacucho 271, Lima 15063 PeruAfter your visit, you will have some free minutes to enjoy seeing how artisans make handcrafts and, if you wish, you can buy some of them. Then, you will visit the Barranco District and on the way there, you will admire the Green Coast beaches, the Wetlands of Villa in the Chorrillos District and the views of the Pacific Ocean. At Barranco, you will take a walk and see the Bridge of the Sights, a church from the 19th century and the lookout point of Barranco which is a quiet attraction for many couples enjoying a nice view of the Pacific Ocean and other districts of Lima city.

 At the end of your tour, you will be taken back to your hotel by private vehicle.Duration: 1 hourStop At:Barranco, Lima PeruEnjoy the murals and the view of the City from Barranco District, a place that calls visitors with its attractions and food.Duration: 30 minutes

Experience with the Creator of the Universe

We spent interesting hours, we were well oriented and cared for our needs.
The ruins show the past of the years and the people who lived there. The view from the sun temple is very beautiful...It gives to imagine how it was centuries ago, a green valley, the sea at the bottom. A pleasant sense of peace.

A Great Tour With a Friendly and Knowledgeable English Speaking Guide

Dec 2023 • Family
My wife, son and I joined Carlos on the private tour of Pachacamac and Barranco. The communication via Whatsapp prior to the trip was excellent and timely. The private vehicle was new and very comfortable. Carlos was very knowledgeable and shared the history of Peru and each district we passed through on our trip from Miraflores to the archaeological site. His English is very good and he answered our questions completely. He happily tailored the tour to our particular needs. We highly recommend this tour with Carlos!
Written December 1, 2023

All about Lima

Great private tour with an experienced and knowledgeable tour guide. We were in Lima for a couple of days before heading to Cusco so we decided to book this tour to learn a little about the history of Lima. And that we sure did. We also enjoyed exploring south of Lima. Also I would like to note, I was notified a day before confirming the hotel pickup time and they were right on time the next day. I would highly recommend this tour.
Written July 3, 2022

A terrible tour company - avoid them!

Oct 2021 • Friends
My friend and I had some extra time in Peru at the end of a business trip, and decided to book a tour of Pachacamac because it was relatively close by, and fit the amount of time we had. We found a tour done by “Peru Best Price” which had good ratings, even though the most recent rating was over a year old. That should have been a red flag for me.

Our pick up from the hotel was supposed to be at 9 AM, but by 9:15 AM they had not shown or emailed to say they were going to be late, up so I contacted the company. The phone connection was poor so they contacted me on WhatsApp. I asked the driver what the problem was, and he said that they could not do the tour today because of “COVID-19 policies“ which he claimed required that you book reservations “5 days in advance.” I told him that there was nothing on the website which specified that, and that the system allowed us to select the date and time we wanted, and that I was unhappy. He then advised he was going to contact the facility, and a few minutes later wrote that he “might“ be able to get us an afternoon tour. I told the tour operator that would not fit with our schedule, and said that if we had to book 5 days in advance, why is it we would be able to do an afternoon tour, but not the morning tour that we bought, and he had no response.

I told him it was very poor customer service to make me have to track him down to find out why nobody had shown up, and his response was that we could ask for a refund!

My advice is to avoid this company at all costs. They will not contact you, will leave you high and dry, and then when you press them on something, their answer is that you can ask for a refund. I am sure there are better tour companies out there, and I would never use these people again. I also do not know why Viator has them listed as an available option, when it is pretty clear they have such poor customer service.
Written October 1, 2021
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.

reviews.title: Great 1/2 day tour
reviews.text: My wife and I did this tour while waiting on a group tour to arrive. We were very pleased with Carlos and the driver Mr David. Carlos spoke great English and was very knowledgeable about Peru and the history of the places we visited.

reviews.title: Awesome private tour with Jordan!
reviews.text: Booked private tour for 4 adults. Had an awesome private tour by Jordan and his driver. He spoke very good English and was very knowledgeable about the sites.

reviews.title: Such a great tour!
reviews.text: Carlos was a fabulous tour guide. Very knowledgeable, kind, and helpful. Would definitely recommend this tour to anyone visiting Lima.

reviews.title: Great solo trip to Pachacamac
reviews.text: Carlos my guide met me at the hotel and we spent 3 hours touring Lima and the incredible Pachamac location.  He is a senior guide with the Ministry of Tourism and was allowed to drive his vehicle within the National Park, other guides and guests had to walk a fair distance to see the Temples.  We climbed the main Temple and also took me to see a convent next door from the Incas.  His knowledge of the different civilizations and how they evolved allowed me to have a clearer picture of the base of the Inca Empire.  I would recommend this tour highly.

reviews.title: Wonderful tour
reviews.text: My husband and I did this tour on our first day in Lima. Our guide, Jean-Paul, was so knowledgeable and gave us the history in such an interesting manner. The site is very much worth the visit- it was an amazing site and we learned so much about the history of Peru. Stopping at Barranca on the way back showed us another personality of this diverse city.I highly recommend this tour and this tour company. The guide and driver were outstanding.
